## Arithmetic Operators

<br>

> "Arithmetic operators are used with numeric values to perform common mathematical operations."

## Arithmetic Operators

<br>

| Operator | Name           | Example |
|----------|----------------|---------|
| `+`      | Addition       | x + y   |
| `-`      | Subtraction    | x - y   |
| `*`      | Multiplication | x * y  |
| `/`      | Division       | x / y   |
| `^`      | Exponent       | x ^ y  |

::: aside
Source: [w3schools](https://www.w3schools.com/r/r_operators.asp)
:::

## R Comparison Operators

<br>

> "Comparison operators are used to compare two values."

## R Comparison Operators

<br>

| Operator | Name                     | Example |
|----------|--------------------------|---------|
| `==`     | Equal                    | x == y  |
| `!=`     | Not equal                | x != y  |
| `>`      | Greater than             | x > y   |
| `<`      | Less than                | x < y   |
| `>=`     | Greater than or equal to | x >= y  |
| `<=`     | Less than or equal to    | x <= y  |

<!-- ::: aside -->
<!-- [Source: [w3schools](https://www.w3schools.com/r/r_operators.asp)]{.small} -->

## Round function

::: panel-tabset
### Code

Function with default argument.

```{r}
#| label: fun-round2
#| eval: false

round(x = 42.58756)
```

or 

```{r}
#| label: fun-round22
#| eval: false

round(42.58756)
```

### Output

```{r}
#| label: fun-round2
#| echo: false
#| output: asis

```

or

```{r}
#| label: fun-round22
#| echo: false
#| output: asis

```
:::

## Round function

::: panel-tabset
### Code

Function with a specific value of an argument.

```{r}
#| label: fun-round3
#| eval: false

round(x = 46.58754, digits = 2)
```

or

```{r}
#| label: fun-round33
#| eval: false

round(46.58754, 2)
```

### Output

```{r}
#| label: fun-round3
#| echo: false
#| output: asis

```

or

```{r}
#| label: fun-round33
#| echo: false
#| output: asis

```
:::

## Sequence Function

::: panel-tabset
### Code

Function with a specific value of an argument.

```{r}
#| label: fun-seq
#| eval: false

seq.int(from = 10, to = 30, by = 5)
```

or

```{r}
#| label: fun-seq1
#| eval: false

seq.int(from = 10,
        to = 30,
        by = 5)
```

or

```{r}
#| label: fun-seq11
#| eval: false

seq.int(10, 30, 5)
```

### Output

```{r}
#| label: fun-seq
#| echo: false
#| output: asis

```

or 

```{r}
#| label: fun-seq1
#| echo: false
#| output: asis

```

or

```{r}
#| label: fun-seq11
#| echo: false
#| output: asis

```

:::

## Create Function 

– reusable set of instructions

```{r}
add <- function(x, y) {
  return(x + y)
}

add(3, 4)   # Output: 7
```
